Package event

Interface EventListener<E extends Event>

Type Parameters:
E - The type of events that the listener can handle.
All Superinterfaces:
Comparable<EventListener<E>>
public interface EventListener<E extends Event> extends Comparable<EventListener<E>>
An interface for objects that listen for and respond to specific events.
Since:
1.0

  • Method Summary

    Modifier and Type
    Method
    Description
    default int
    compareTo(EventListener<E> o)
    Compares this event listener with another based on priority.
    default int
    priority()
    Retrieves the priority of the event listener.
    void
    update(E event)
    Called when an event occurs.

  • Method Details

    • update

      void update(E event)
      Called when an event occurs. Implementing classes should define how they respond to the specific type of event they are interested in.
      Parameters:
      event - The event object containing information about the event.

    • priority

      default int priority()
      Retrieves the priority of the event listener.

      The priority value indicates the order in which listeners should be notified when multiple listeners are subscribed to the same event type. Higher priority values indicate that the listener should be notified earlier.

      Returns:
      The priority value of the event listener.

    • compareTo

      default int compareTo(EventListener<E> o)
      Compares this event listener with another based on priority.

      The default implementation uses the priority values to determine the order. Listeners with higher priority values come first.

      Specified by:
      compareTo in interface Comparable<E extends Event>
      Parameters:
      o - The other event listener to compare to.
      Returns:
      A negative integer, zero, or a positive integer as this object is less than, equal to, or greater than the specified object.
